trans-unit.source: Configure an FTP Destination
trans-unit.target: Configure an FTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Configure an FTP destination for sending messages from a <token>bridge</token> to an FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Configure an FTP destination for sending messages from a <token>bridge</token> to an FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Just like the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component, the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component can be used as the destination for an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.
trans-unit.target: Just like the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component, the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component can be used as the destination for an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.

trans-unit.source: An <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component cannot be used a destination for <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: An <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component cannot be used a destination for <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: Once you have added a <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow</token> designer, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel> and connect the <token>bridge</token> to the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component.
trans-unit.target: Once you have added a <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow</token> designer, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel> and connect the <token>bridge</token> to the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component.

trans-unit.source: A bridge deployed in <token>af_integration</token> can only send messages to an FTP server hosted in a public domain.
trans-unit.target: A bridge deployed in <token>af_integration</token> can only send messages to an FTP server hosted in a public domain.

trans-unit.source: In order to successfully route messages to an FTP Destination, the FTP FileName must be added as a Route Action.
trans-unit.target: In order to successfully route messages to an FTP Destination, the FTP FileName must be added as a Route Action.

trans-unit.source: This FileName can either be a promoted property from the FTP Source or it could be hardcoded as an expression.
trans-unit.target: This FileName can either be a promoted property from the FTP Source or it could be hardcoded as an expression.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="c69c6ce1-8fb1-4606-9d6b-d22cc9c64515" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tutorials and Samples</link> provides some end-to-end scenarios.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="c69c6ce1-8fb1-4606-9d6b-d22cc9c64515" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tutorials and Samples</link> provides some end-to-end scenarios.

trans-unit.source: To add an FTP Destination to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>
trans-unit.target: To add an FTP Destination to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, as described in <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, as described in <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>FTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the FTP destination component.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the FTP destination component.

trans-unit.source: Folder Path
trans-unit.target: Folder Path

trans-unit.source: Enter the folder on the FTP server where the <token>bridge</token> sends the message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the folder on the FTP server where the <token>bridge</token> sends the message.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to send a message to CustomerFiles\Contoso FTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to send a message to CustomerFiles\Contoso FTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the username password that can send files to an FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username password that can send files to an FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Server Address
trans-unit.target: Server Address

trans-unit.source: Enter the FTP server name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Enter the FTP server name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Server Port
trans-unit.target: Server Port

trans-unit.source: Enter the FTP server port.
trans-unit.target: Enter the FTP server port.

trans-unit.source: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.
trans-unit.target: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.

trans-unit.source: Transfer Mode
trans-unit.target: Transfer Mode

trans-unit.source: Enter Binary or ASCII as the Transfer Mode.
trans-unit.target: Enter Binary or ASCII as the Transfer Mode.

trans-unit.source: Default is Binary.
trans-unit.target: Default is Binary.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the messages only contain text-type of data, select ASCII.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the messages only contain text-type of data, select ASCII.

trans-unit.source: If the messages contain any type of data, select Binary.
trans-unit.target: If the messages contain any type of data, select Binary.

trans-unit.source: Use SSL
trans-unit.target: Use SSL

trans-unit.source: Select True if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.
trans-unit.target: Select True if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
